input_text:
Job Title: Software Engineer

Location: Mission, KS

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Job Summary:As a Software Engineer II, you’ll work on our Automotive Marketing Platform (AMP) product that is changing the way dealers are marketing to customers through email, CRM tasks, text messaging, direct mail, and Facebook with more channels to come. Our applications are written in .NetCore and AWS. We use New Relic, Splunk, and PagerDuty to monitor and alert on our platform. 
We own and are responsible for our applications from design, development, testing, deployment, and support. Our infrastructure is a mix of on-prem and AWS, and we manage it using Terraform. We use CI/CD best practices to develop, test, and deploy our applications. We use a wide variety of AWS services, including but not limited to Elastic Beanstalk, Elastic Container Service, Lambdas, SQS, Dynamo DB, Terraform, and RDS to process a large volume of data, work with products and architects to learn, and apply those learnings to future product and technical development. Our engineering organization supports addressing technical debt. In addition to working with product owners to prioritize and fix defects as necessary, we reserve one sprint a quarter to work on things that are bugging us. This can include but is not limited to cleaning up noisy alerts, automating manual processes, and revisiting code if we think there’s a better way to do it using the tools we have available. We have an annual Hackathon with winners going on to compete at a higher level within our parent company. We have time reserved on the calendar annually to learn more about both internal and external products. If you want to work on highly performant software running at scale in the cloud, with the ability to both learn new technologies and have an impact on our ability to succeed as a team, organization, and company, this job is for you.
 Technologies: .NetCore, C#, SQL, AWS (including but not limited to Elastic Beanstalk, Elastic Container Service, Lambdas, SQS, Dynamo DB, Terraform, and RDS), Typescript, Snowflake, dbt, NewRelic, Splunk, K6, SpecFlow, GitHub, Octopus, Resharper
Your Role:marketing solutions for expanding our Automotive Marketing Platformbuild, and support cloud-native applications that serve our digital marketing stakeholdersWork with senior-level engineers on the team to implement patterns for our organization that deliver our software products at scale with observability, performance, and securityMentor junior-level engineers on best practices and standardsand build service-oriented architecture solutions, constructing and managing services published to both internal and external consumers, and integrating with complex database and third-party componentswith your agile delivery team to build a culture of passion, trust, and creativityand leverage the automotive digital marketing domain to change the way the world buys, sells, and uses cars
Qualifications  Required Experience:degree in Computer Science or related field or relevant experience. Advanced technical degree and/or related training a plus.years of multi-threaded server-side web application development experience

Compensation:Up to $100k/yr per year annual salary. Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education. Benefit packages for this role include: Benefit packages for this role may include healthcare insurance offerings and paid leave as provided by applicable law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
